title: San Antonio Opera
text: The San Antonio Opera was an American <a href="opera">opera</a> company located in <a href="San%20Antonio">San Antonio</a>, <a href="Texas">Texas</a> that produced 16 seasons of <a href="opera">opera</a> before filing for <a href="bankruptcy">bankruptcy</a> and dissolving in 2012. The company was founded as the Pocket Opera of San Antonio in 1997 by <a href="Mark%20Richter">Mark Richter</a>, and opened its first season in the fall of 1997 with <a href="Wolfgang%20Amadeus%20Mozart">Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart</a>'s "<a href="Der%20Schauspieldirektor">Der Schauspieldirektor</a>" at the <a href="San%20Pedro%20Playhouse">San Pedro Playhouse</a>. Initially the company's productions utilized local artists, but by the 1999-2000 season the company had begun employing internationally recognized artists. It simultaneously rebranded itself as the Lyric Opera of San Antonio and began performing at the <a href="Lila%20Cockrell%20Theatre">Lila Cockrell Theatre</a>. The opera company changed its name to the San Antonio Opera a few years later. Notable artists to have performed with the company include <a href="Pl%C3%A1cido%20Domingo">Plácido Domingo</a>, <a href="Jos%C3%A9%20Carreras">José Carreras</a>, and <a href="Andrea%20Bocelli">Andrea Bocelli</a> among others.
